greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Totally multiplicative with p -> (p-1)*p, p prime.
comment: Multiplicative sequence with a(p^e) = p^e*(p-1)^e for prime p. [From _Jaroslav Krizek_, Nov 01 2009]
The Dirichlet inverse is 1, -2, -6, 0, -20, 12, -42, 0, 0, 40, -110, 0, -156, 84, 120, 0, -272, ..., i.e., the sequence defined by mu(n)*a(n). - R. J. Mathar, Dec 20 2011
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: sum_{n>=1} a(n)/n^s = product_{primes p} 1/(1+p^(1-s)-p^(2-s)). - R. J. Mathar, Dec 20 2011
program: a079579 n = product $ zipWith (*) pfs $ map (subtract 1) pfs
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 24 2003
